assignmentCode

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignmentCode.Item

  • public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    Item Class. This is how Items are represented throughout the system. Stores basic information about the item that will be useful for store operations
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Locke

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Integer cost,
            java.lang.Integer price,
            java.lang.Integer restockPoint,
            java.lang.Integer restockAmount,
            java.lang.Integer temperature,
            java.lang.Integer quantity)
        Constructor for Item class
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item (ie rice, banana)
        cost - The cost to make an individual item (ie 1 bag of rice, a single banana)
        price - The price of an individual item
        restockPoint - When the quantity drops below this number, more must be ordered
        restockAmount - The amount to be ordered
        temperature - The temperature that the item must be kept below. Can be null, which indicates it doesn't need to be temperature controlled
        quantity - The amount of items this object represents. A value of 50 would indicate 50 bags of rice, or 50 bananas

      • addQuantity

        public void addQuantity(java.lang.Integer Quantity)
        Adds the given integer to the quantity of an item. Negative numbers will reduce quantity
        Parameters:
